medical_history.chief_complaint: Worsening abdominal pain and bloody diarrhea.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was in his usual state of health until 1.5 weeks prior to presentation when he began passing bloody, mucousy stools and decreased appetite. Several days later, he developed diffuse abdominal pressure and soreness. He followed his standard protocol for treating flares by gradually increasing his mesalamine dose from 1 pill/day to 3 pills/day. Over the weekend, the bloody bowel movements persisted, and his abdominal pain progressively worsened to sharp, continuous pain in the LUQ and RUQ. The pain became severe enough to awaken him from sleep and worsened with oral intake and while lying supine. Denies colicky pain or radiation to the back.
medical_history.past_medical_history: 1. Chronic colitis with negative Prometheus IBD markers;  2. Hiatal hernia.
medical_history.family_history: Maternal grandmother had colorectal cancer. Father and paternal grandfather with hypertension and hypercholesterolemia. Paternal aunt has hyperthyroidism. Sister has clotting disorder, possibly unknown type.
